item.title: Need 28 Of The item
item.dc:creator: @TheMyth TheMyth
item.description:
@TheMyth wrote:

no you would do this:

if (UsedOnObjectID == 7316 && ItemID == 605 && hasItem(605, 28)) { setAnimation(883); animationReset = System.currentTimeMillis() + 1000; deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); deleteItem(605, 1); addItem(1053, 1); sendMessage("You have Completed the Halloween Event I hope you like your reward."); } }else{ sendMessage("YOU MESSAGE FOR NOT ENOUGH ITEMS"); }
(ive probaly got the amount of }'s wrong thats just a basic

setAnimation(883);
animationReset = System.currentTimeMillis() + 1000;
&& hasItem(605, 28);

}

item.description:
@spon80 wrote:

i think the items gotta be stackable for that though,

here instead of your delete item thing put this instead

for (int i = 0; i < 29; i++) {
deleteItem(605, getItemSlot(605), i);
}
